apiErrorTrialNotFound: The requested trial was not found on the server. Please check the share code is correct and get in touch with the person who shared the code with you.
errorMessageInvalidSettingsQR: Invalid QR code. Please try scanning it again or regenerate on the source device.
errorMessageDataImportInvalidColumns: One or more of the required columns are missing. Please check if the data is in tab-delimited format and has the correct column headers. Also check their capitalization.
errorMessageDataImportInvalidGermplasmRe: The following germplasm/rep combination in row {row} has not been found in the trial and therefore, the data cannot be imported: {missing}
errorMessageDataImportInvalidTrait: The following trait in row {row} has not been found in the trial and therefore, the data cannot be imported: {missing}
errorMessageDataImportInvalidValue: The following value in row {row} is not valid for the specified trait. It either has the wrong data type or does not fulfil the trait restrictions: {value}
errorMessageDataImportInvalidDate: The following date in row {row} is not valid. Please provide dates in the yyyy-mm-dd format: {date}
errorMessageDataImportInvalidSetSize: The following set value in row {row} is not valid. The trait set size is {setSize}, but {provided} values have been provided: {value}
errorMessageBrapiPermissionUnauthorized: The BrAPI endpoint requires a token to be provided for this operation. Please enter the token you received from the endpoint.
errorMessageBrapiPermissionForbidden: The requested operation is not permitted with the token you provided. Please get in touch with the endpoint maintainer.
errorMessagePersonTypeMissing: Please select at least one person role.
errorMessageRemoteTrialInvalidToken: The remote server requires authorization, but the specified remote token is invalid. Please check the provided remote URL and token.
errorMessageBadRequest: Bad request. Please check all required parameters have been provided.
errorMessageForbidden: Access forbidden. Please check your permissions for this operation.
errorMessageNotFound: The requested resource has not been found.
formDescriptionSettingsLocale: The locale of the user interface
formDescriptionSettingsTheme: Switch between light, dark and automatic mode. Dark mode will work better in dark environments while light mode will work better in the sunlight.
formDescriptionSettingsUseGps: Should GPS information be collected and associated with recorded data?
formDescriptionSettingsRowOrder: Choose whether rows should be numbered top-to-bottom (top row has number 1) or bottom-to-top (bottom row has number 1).
formDescriptionSettingsColumnOrder: Choose whether columns should be numbered left-to-right (left column has number 1) or right-to-left (right column has number 1).
formDescriptionSettingsDisplayMarkerIndi: If enabled and configured, marker indicators will be shown on the main data view to aid with navigation.
formDescriptionSettingsVoiceFeedback: If enabled, speech synthesis (text-to-speech) will be used to audibly repeat data input as well as plot selection. This can be useful to reduce errors.
formDescriptionSettingsNavigationMode: Switch between 'drag/scroll' navigation or 'jump' navigation. These allow you to move the main data display of GridScore either by dragging/scrolling or by jumping in any direction with a directional pad.
formDescriptionSettingsPlotDisplayField: Choose which information of each plot is shown on the main data input. The display name consists of germplasm identifier and rep information.
formDescriptionSettingsMinCellWidth: This value determines how many trait circles are shown in a single row before wrapping around. This setting sets a lower bound, i.e. at least this many trait circles are shown per row in the plot.
formDescriptionHeatmapTrait: The trait for which to plot the heatmap.
formDescriptionSettingsTraitColors: These colors are used to visually represent the traits.
formDescriptionSettingsTraitColorAdd: Add a new trait color to the existing list.
formDescriptionSettingsRestrictInputToMa: If enabled, selecting plots on the data entry view is only possible within the marked row/column.
formDescriptionSettingsWidgetOrder: Use the handle in the top right to drag and reorder the widgets on the home page.
formDescriptionSettingsCategoryCountInli: Decide up to how many trait category values are shown as buttons inline before showing a dropdown box.
formDescriptionSettingsHighlightControls: Should controls/checks be highlighted in the main data display and data visualizations?
formDescriptionSettingsLargeButtonsForIn: Show larger buttons for numeric traits to make it easier to use these buttons as counters.
formDescriptionSettingsPrimaryColor: Set the primary color used through the GridScore NEXT interface.
formDescriptionStatisticsTrait: The traits for which to plot the statistics.
formDescriptionStatisticsGermplasm: Optionally, sub-select a set of germplasm to highlight in the charts.
formFeedbackLayout: No issues found in your data.|One issue found in your data.|{count} issues found in your data.
formLabelDescriptionRows: Specify the number of rows in your trial layout.
formLabelDescriptionColumns: Specify the number of columns in your trial layout.
formLabelFieldLayoutUseAsCorner: Use this location as field corner:
formDescriptionSetupGermplasmGridMarkChe: Enter a germplasm identifier to mark all its reps as controls.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialName: Enter a unique and descriptive trial name.
formDescriptionTrialExpirationCaptcha: Please enter the text you see in the image into this text box. You can request a new captcha by pressing the circle arrow icon.
formDescriptionTrialSelectorSearch: Search for the trial name, trial description or a trait name.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialDescriptio: Optionally, enter a description of the dataset. This can include any meaningful information about the trial.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialGroup: Optionally, assign trials into groups for better organization.

Friendly name in row 2 column 1	Friendly name in row 2 column 2	Friendly name in row 2 column 3
etc.

Barcode in row 2 column 1	Barcode in row 2 column 2	Barcode in row 2 column 3

Treatment in row 2 column 1	Treatment in row 2 column 2	Treatment in row 2 column 3
etc.
formPlaceholderSetupPedigreeNames:

Pedigree in row 2 column 1	Pedigree in row 2 column 2	Pedigree in row 2 column 3
etc.
formDescriptionTraitName: The name shown on data input and data visualizations to represent this trait.
formDescriptionTraitDescription: Optional description of the trait. This can include the unit the trait is measured in or an explanation of the trait value categories.
formDescriptionTraitDataType: The data type of the trait. This determines the type of data that can be recorded for this trait.
formDescriptionTraitRestrictionsCategori: The valid options for this categorical trait. Users have to choose one of these options. Type in the category value, then press <kbd>Enter</kbd>.
formDescriptionTraitRestrictionsMin: An optional minimum value for the numeric trait.
formDescriptionTraitRestrictionsMax: An optional maximum value for the numeric trait.
formDescriptionTraitSetSize: This determines how many values per plot have to be recorded at any time. This can, for example, represent the number of individual plants that are sampled per plot for this trait.
formDescriptionTraitAllowRepeats: When enabled, it's possible to repeatedly measure this trait over time. When disabled, only a single set of values can be recorded throughout the whole trial.
formDescriptionTraitGroup: Group traits together into meaningful sets to keep the interface tidy.
formDescriptionTraitTimeframe: You can restrict in which date range this trait can be scored. This can be set as a suggestion or it can be enforced meaning that no data can be recorded for this trait outside of this date range.
formDescriptionTraitTimeframeStart: The start date of the timeframe. If enforced, no data entry before this date will be possible.
formDescriptionTraitTimeframeType: Choose whether you want this timeframe to be a suggestion or to be enforced. Enforcement means it will not be possible to enter data outside of the timeframe, while suggestions will only be displayed to the user as information.
formDescriptionTraitTimeframeEnd: The end date of the timeframe. If enforced, no data entry after this date will be possible.
formFeedbackTraitNameInvalidOrDuplicate: Please provide a trait name that hasn't already been defined.
formFeedbackTraitRangeMissingBoundaries: Please specify both minimum and maximum values.
formFeedbackTraitInvalidMinMax: Invalid combination of minimum and maximum specified.
formFeedbackTraitCategoryOnlyOne: Please specify at least two categories.
formPlaceholderFielDBookInput:
ID		LOCATION	PLOT	ROW	COLUMN	REP					TREATMENT
ID-1	L-1			101		1		1			Rep in row 1 column 1	Germplasm in row 1 column 1

formDescriptionFielDBookRow: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the field row.
formDescriptionFielDBookColumn: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the field column.
formDescriptionFielDBookGermplasm: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the plot germplasm.
formDescriptionFielDBookRep: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the plot rep.
formDescriptionFielDBookTreatment: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the treatment.
formDescriptionFielDBookFriendlyName: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the friendly name.
formDescriptionFielDBookBarcode: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the barcode.
formDescriptionFielDBookPedigree: The column header in the fieldbook containing information about the pedigree.
formFeedbackFielDBookMissingData: No data has been provided. Please paste the data into the text box or load it using the file selector.
formFeedbackFielDBookMissingGermplasm: A germplasm in line {line} of your input is missing. If you want to leave that plot empty, please remove it altogether from the file.
formFeedbackFielDBookMissingInvalidRow: The provided row index in line {line} of your input is either missing or not a numeric value.
formFeedbackFielDBookMissingInvalidColum: The provided column index in line {line} of your input is either missing or not a numeric value.
formFeedbackFielDBookInvalidDimensions: The row ({row}) or column ({column}) index in line {line} of your input is not within the trial dimensions you specified previously.
formFeedbackSetupInvalidRowColumn: The dimensions (rows: {row}, columns: {column}) of the trial have not been specified. Please enter both the row and column counts.
formFeedbackSetupMissingGermplasm: The germplasm information per plot hasn't been specified. Please enter the germplasm identifiers and optional reps into row {rowIndex} and column {columnIndex} of the table.
formFeedbackSetupInvalidRow: The specified layout contains an invalid row index ({rowIndex}) for germplasm ({germplasm}) and rep ({rep}).
formFeedbackSetupInvalidColumn: The specified layout contains an invalid column index ({columnIndex}) for germplasm ({germplasm}) and rep ({rep}).
formFeedbackSetupDuplicateGermplasmRep: The trial layout contains a duplicate germplasm ({germplasm}) and rep ({rep}) combination in row {rowIndex} and column {columnIndex}.
formFeedbackSetupDuplicateBarcode: The trial layout contains a duplicate barcode ({barcode}) in row {rowIndex} and column {columnIndex}.
formFeedbackSetupNoGermplasm: No germplasm has been specified. Please use the germplasm/rep information tab to do so.
formFeedbackSetupInvalidCorners: The specified trial layout corners are invalid. This can either mean that the latitude or longitude for a corner point is missing or that not all four corners have been defined.
formFeedbackSetupInvalidMarkers: The visual marker definition is incomplete. Please provide the anchor as well as the repeat distance per dimension or disable visual markers.
formFeedbackSetupHighNumberOfReps: You have a very high number of distinct rep values ({repCount}) compared to your number of individual plots ({germplasmCount}).
formFeedbackTraitImportInvalidColumnHead: Invalid column headers. Please provide these column headers: {headers}
formFeedbackTraitImportInvalidDateFormat: Invalid date format used for timeframe start or end. Please provide dates in the form yyyy-MM-dd.
formDescriptionCommentContent: The content of the comment you wish to add.
formDescriptionEventContent: The content of the event you wish to add.
formDescriptionTraitImportExportJson: These are the trait definitions in JSON format compatible with GridScore.
formDescriptionTraitImportExportGerminat: These are the trait definitions in Germinate format compatible with the Germinate template for trials data.
formDescriptionTraitImportExportTabular: These are the trait definitions in tabular format. Ensure dates are in yyyy-MM-dd format.
formDescriptionTrialImportUrl: The URL of the legacy GridScore version. By default this is https://ics.hutton.ac.uk/gridscore/
formDescriptionTrialImportCode: The QR code that has been shared with you. Alternatively, use the QR code button to the right to scan a code with the camera.
formDescriptionExportTrialFormatGerminat: Decide whether values should be averaged across sets and measurements on the same day.
formDescriptionExportTrialFormatTabLongI: Should information about the person collecting the data be included?
formDescriptionExportTrialFormatTabLongU: Should the specific timestamp of data collection be used in the export rather than just the date?
formDescriptionBrapiUrl: The URL of the BrAPI endpoint. Usually of the form {URL}/brapi/v2/
formDescriptionBrapiToken: A token may be required for write operations or access limitations
formDescriptionDuplicateTrialName: The new name of the duplicated trial
formDescriptionDuplicateTrialDescription: An optional description of the trial. This may include information about why the trial was duplicated.
formDescriptionDuplicateTrialCopyData:
Decide whether to include the currently existing data in the duplicate. Selecting 'Yes' will create an identical duplicate including layout, traits and recorded data, while selecting 'No' will create an empty copy of the trial using the same layout and traits, but no recorded data.

Please note that data will be copied per plot based on its location, so if you swapped two germplasm identifiers in the layout, the associated data wouldn't be swapped.
formMessageDuplicateTrialCopyDataNotPoss: Due to changes made to the trial dimensions, it is not possible to copy the existing data across.
formDescriptionDuplicateTrialTraits: Select the traits to include in the duplicated trial.
formDescriptionTrialDataUploadContent: Use this text field to upload data into this trial.

formDescriptionSettingsCanvasDensity: This determines how densely packed the main data display is drawn. The higher the density the closer together the individual components are. A higher density will allow more plots to be visible on the screen at a time.
formDescriptionSettingsCanvasShape: Change the shape of the data points shown on the main data display.
formDescriptionSettingsCanvasSize: Change the size of the data point shape on the main data display.
formDescriptionSettingsCitation: Decide whether or not to hide the citation banner on the home page.
formDescriptionSettingsShowFullTraitDesc: If enabled, the full trait description will be shown on the data input screen, if disabled, it will be cropped to one line.
formDescriptionTrialSelectorOrderBy: Select how to sort the trials in the list below.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialSocialCont: Optionally, define content that will be included in photos shared on social media.
The parameters below are part of the Web Share API. Depending on your operating system, browser and the app that is used to share the content any or all of these may be ignored by the sharing app.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialSocialText: Text content to use with the shared media. This can include hashtags.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialSocialUrl: A web address to be shared.
formDescriptionEventType: Choose what type of event you want to record.
formDescriptionEventImpact: Estimate the impact of the event on the trial ranging from low (1) to high (5).
formDescriptionEventDate: Select the date when this event took place. This defaults to today.
formDescriptionPersonName: Name used to identify this person.
formDescriptionPersonEmail: Contact email address for this person.
formDescriptionPersonRole: A role that determines the main purpose of this person. Please note that these do not affect the way GridScore behaves.
formDescriptionTrialSetupTrialPeople: Optionally, define everyone who is involved in this trial.
formDescriptionSettingsTraitColorPreset: Choose one of these commonly used color presets.
formDescriptionSettingsMainDisplayMode: The display mode determines how the main view is rendered. Automatic chooses based on trial size, while canvas uses the mode GridScore used so far. Choose canvas if you noticed any performance issues.
formCheckboxShareWithRemote: Share with other GridScore NEXT server?
formDescriptionTrialShareRemoteUrl: The URL of the other GridScore NEXT server you want to share this trial with.
formDescriptionTrialShareRemoteToken: If the remote server requires a security token to be provided, enter it here.
formDescriptionTrialLoadRemoteToken: If the remote server requires a security token to be provided, enter it here.
formCheckboxLoadFromRemote: Load from other GridScore NEXT server?
formDescriptionTrialLoadRemoteUrl: The URL of the other GridScore NEXT server you want to load this trial from.
formDescriptionSettingsEnterBarcode: A barcode that, when scanned, will close the data input and save any entered data.
formDescriptionSettingsEscapeBarcode: A barcode that, when scanned, will close the data input discarding any entered data.
formDescriptionSettingsAutoSelectSearch: If enabled, GridScore will automatically re-select the search box when closing the data input. This is particularly useful for cases where barcodes are used for most of the data input.
formDescriptionSettingsAutoProgressInput: If enabled, GridScore will automatically select the next input field in the data input screen after a value has been entered.
formDescriptionTraitDropdownCutoffDate: Only show values recorded after this date.
formDescriptionTrialSetupMediaFilenameTe: Drag and drop between the two lists to add/remove elements from the filename template. Drag within a list to change the order of elements.
modalTextHideCitation: Are you sure you want to hide this information? You can still find the reference on the 'About' page.
modalTextChangelog: Below is a list of recent versions of GridScore including the major changes and new features they introduced. In case of any questions or issues, please contact us via email.
modalTextTrialComment: Below is a list of all the comments added to this trial. Use the buttons to add new comments or remove old ones.
modalTextTrialEvent: Below is a list of all the events added to this trial. Use the buttons to add new events or remove old ones.
modalTextTrialExpiration: This trial will expire soon. This means that it'll be deleted from the server, but it'll still exist on your local device. If you wish to extend the lifetime of this trial on the server, please enter the text you see in the image into the text box below and submit.
modalTextTrialPreview: Please check over the trial details below and confirm the creation of this trial with the button in the top right corner.
modalTextTrialImportPermissionUpgrade: You have provided a code with permission status '{remote}', but you have a local copy of this trial with permission status '{local}'. Your local trial has now automatically been upgraded.
modalTextTrialExpirationNotAuthorized: You don't have sufficient permissions to extend the lifetime of a trial.
modalTextPlotComment: Below is a list of all the comments added to this plot. Use the buttons to add new comments or remove old ones.
modalTextPlotComments: Below is a list of all the comments added to plots within this trial.
modalTextDeleteTrial: This operation will remove the selected trial from your device. Any unsaved changes will be lost. Are you sure you want to delete the selected trial?
modalTextDeleteTrials: This operation will remove the selected trials from your device. Any unsaved changes will be lost. Are you sure you want to delete the selected trials?
modalTextDeleteTrait: Are you sure you want to delete the selected trait?
modalTextDeleteTraitFromSharedTrial:
Are you sure you want to delete the selected trait?

This is a shared trial, deleting a trait will remove any recorded data for this trait on your device but also on other people's devices once they synchronize.
modalConfirmMessageConfirm: Please confirm your decision before continuing.
modalTextDeleteTraits: Are you sure you want to delete all current trait?
modalTextDeleteLocalChanges: This will delete any changes you have made on this device since you last synchronized this trial. Do you really want to delete all local changes?
modalTextTabbedInputToGrid: Paste your tabbed data into the text box or use the file selector to select a '.txt' file with your tabbed content.
modalTextFielDBookInput: Here you can import the fieldbook output generated by e.g. FielDHub. Just copy and paste the content of the .csv file either from Excel or a text editor into this text box. Then use the button below to extract the column mapping.
modalTextFielDBookColumnMapping: Use this section to map the columns in the input file with their corresponding purpose, i.e. select the column containing the germplasm identifier information in the 'Germplasm' dropdown.
modalTextLayoutFeedback: Some issues have been found in your trial layout and are listed below. Please check your input again and fix these issues before continuing.
modalTextLeaveSetup: Are you sure you want to leave the setup screen? Your progress on the creation of this trial will be lost and you have to start over.
modalTextLeaveDataInput: Are you sure you want to move to the performance page? Any unsaved data input will be lost. Save changes before continuing.
modalTextCreateTrial: Are you sure you want to create a new trial with the specified configuration? After creation, the trial layout cannot be modified.
modalTextCreateTrialGerminateImport: Are you sure you want to import the external trial the following with name? '{trialName}'
modalTextTraitImportTrial: You can import traits from another trial available on this device. Select the trial you want to import traits from, then select the traits to import.
modalTextTraitDataHistory: This window shows the data which has been recorded for this plot and the selected trait. The list below shows all values recorded over time. You can remove or change values to fix issues as required.
modalTextApiError: An unexpected error occurred while trying to communicate with the GridScore server: {error}
modalTextTrialShareCodes:
The QR codes shown below can be used to share this trial with other users. There are up to three different QR codes that determine what permissions a user has on the trial shared with them.

  • An owner code gives them the same permissions as the original creator of the trial.
  • The editor code allows the user to enter new and edit existing data as well as add traits.
  • The viewer code will prevent the user from making any changes, but they will be able to see and export all the data that has been collected.

Once the trial has been shared using one of these codes, that user's permissions cannot be changed unless the trial is shared with them again, so make sure to pick the suitable QR code when sharing.
modalTextTrialShare:
Trials can easily be shared between GridScore devices using QR codes. An internet connection is required to share and you may have to grant permissions to use the device's camera.

To share a trial from this device, use the button below to send it to the GridScore server. The server will generate the QR codes used to share this trial. Once generated, you can share one of the QR codes by either email or showing the QR code to them on your device. They will use their device's camera to scan it.

Trials shared using the GridScore server are only accessible using the unique identifier encoded in the QR code. Inactive trials will automatically be deleted from the GridScore server after a period of time if no data synchronisation has taken place. The trial will not be deleted from the local storage on your device even after this period of inactivity.
modalTextTrialSynchronization: The selected trial is a shared trial, which means that multiple people could be collecting data at the same time. To be able to join everyone's data, regular synchronization is recommended. Below is a list of your local changes that have not been synchronized yet. Use the button at the bottom to synchronize your local changes.
modalTextTrialSynchronizationCount: No local changes found.|One local change found.|{count} local changes found.
modalTextTrialSynchronizationRemoteChang: This trial has been changed/updated by others. Use the synchronize button to load their changes and update your local copy of the trial.
modalTextSettingsShare: You can share your local settings with the help of a QR code. Let another user scan the QR code below to share your settings with them or use the second tab below to scan their QR code and load their settings.
modalTextBrapiTrialImport: Import an existing trial from BrAPI using this form. First, adjust the BrAPI settings, then pull the BrAPI Study you want to import. Finally, adjust the row/column labels and order.
modalTextTraitTimeframe: The chart below shows the timeframe in which data for each trait should or has to be collected.
modalTextGuidedWalk: A guided walk will take you through the trial plot by plot on a specific route. Select the order in which to navigate from the current plot below, then start the walk. You can navigate between plots using the 'Next' and 'Back' buttons at the bottom.
modalTextAddTrait: You can add traits even after a trial has been created. Use the form below to add one or more traits in the same way as you did during setup.
modalTextStopGuidedWalk: Are you sure you want to stop the guided walk?
modalTextConfirmCloseDataInput:
Are you sure you want to close the data input? Please select whether to cancel, close or save.
Cancel
Returns to the data input.
Close
Closes the data input without saving any data.
Save
Closes the data input after saving the data.
modalTextGermplasmSearchNoMatchFound: No match found for the entered/scanned identifier.
modalTextSynchronizeTrial: Synchronizing the trial will send all your local changes to the server where they will be visible to everyone this trial has been shared with. Are you sure you want to synchronize your changes?
modalTextAddGermplasm: You can add germplasm to existing trials by specifying the identifier here. The new germplasm will be appended to the end/bottom of the trial.
modalTextTrialDuplicate: Here you can duplicate an existing trial. Depending on the configuration below, recorded data points can also be copied across. Please note, that any sharing codes will not be transferred to the copy, so you have to share the trial with others again using a new code.
modalTextSaveTableChanges:
Your table contains unsaved changes. Leaving this page will discard all unsaved modifications.

Do you want to continue and discard all changes?
modalTextTrialModification: This window allows you to make modifications to some aspects of a trial. This includes changing the name, description, visual markers and geographic corner points of the trial. All other properties cannot be changed.
modalTextNetworkUnavailableWarning: You appear to be offline. Please check your internet connection to use this feature.
modalTextAppUpdateAvailable: An updated version of GridScore NEXT is available. Please use the button below to load the new content and refresh the page.
modalTextTrialDataUpload:
This is where you can import data into an existing trial. The data you upload has to be in a very specific format and you have to use the exact same germplasm identifiers/names and trait names as were specified in the trial setup. Please paste your data in tab-delimited format into the following text field with these columns:

  1. Germplasm: The germplasm identifier/name as specified in the trial setup.
  2. Rep: The rep number as specified in the trial setup. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if no reps are used.
  3. Row: The row index as specified during setup. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if mapping should take place based on germplasm identifier and rep.
  4. Column: The column index as specified during setup. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if mapping should take place based on germplasm identifier and rep.
  5. Trait name: The name of the trait as specified in the trial setup.
  6. Date: The date when this data was recorded in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd (4-digit year, 2-digit month, 2-digit day). If no date is specified, today will be used.
  7. Value: The value for this germplasm/rep/trait combination. This value has to be of the correct type specified for the trait as well as within the restricted limits for numeric traits or one of the specified categories for categorical traits.

Please note, that if you're importing data for a trait with a set size of larger than 1, that all values of a set have to be provided in the Value column separated by commas.
modalTextPlotMetadataUpdate:
This is where you can update plot details of an existing trial. The data you upload has to be in a very specific format and you have to use the exact same germplasm identifiers/names as were specified in the trial setup. Please paste your data in tab-delimited format into the following text field with these columns:

  1. Germplasm: The germplasm identifier/name as specified in the trial setup.
  2. Rep: The rep number as specified in the trial setup. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if no reps are used.
  3. Row: The row index as specified during setup. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if mapping should take place based on germplasm identifier and rep.
  4. Column: The column index as specified during setup. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if mapping should take place based on germplasm identifier and rep.
  5. Treatment: The treatment information you want to set for this germplasm. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if you don't want to update this, set to DELETE if you want to unset the current value.
  6. Friendly name: The friendly display name you want to set for this germplasm. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if you don't want to update this, set to DELETE if you want to unset the current value.
  7. Barcode: The dedicated barcode you want to set for this germplasm. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if you don't want to update this, set to DELETE if you want to unset the current value.
  8. Pedigree: The pedigree information you want to set for this germplasm. Leave blank (not N/A or similar) if you don't want to update this, set to DELETE if you want to unset the current value.
modalTextExportSynchronization: You have unsynchronized local changes. These will not be included in the export without synchronizing first. Would you like to synchronize them before exporting?
modalTextNotTodayWarning: You are recording data for date: {date}
modalTextDataInputReadOnly: This trial is in read-only mode. You can view the data, but cannot make any changes to it.
modalTextImageTaggingIOSWarning: On iOS, after clicking 'Save' below, make sure to properly download the image using the 'Open in...' option before you press 'Done'.
modalTextTrialImportNoValidQRCode: {code} is not a valid GridScore QR code. Please try again.
modalTextEditPeople: Use the form below to add new people to this trial. If defined, users will have to identify themselves by selecting a person from the list before scoring data. Please note that the assigned roles do not change the way GridScore behaves, but are exclusively used to pre-populate data export templates.
modalTextSelectTrialPerson: Please select the person who will be entering the data.
modalTextResetTraitValue: Are you sure you want to reset the trait value? This will erase any value you entered/selected.
modalTextUploadTraitImage: You can upload trait reference images to the GridScore server for a shared trial. These act as visual references to data collectors during the scoring process.
modalTextCategoricalTraitPotentialWrongF:
It looks like you only specified one category option. Individual categories need to be specified one per row/line. If you have specified them as a comma-separated list please convert this to individual rows/lines.

Do you still want to add the trait as it currently is?
pageAboutGitHubLink: The source code of GridScore is available on GitHub.
pageAboutDocumentationLink: A detailed tutorial about how to get up and running with GridScore is available on the <a href='https://cropgeeks.github.io/gridscore-next-client'>documentation page<a/>.
pageAboutTrainingLink: Training material for the use of GridScore is available on a <a href='https://cropgeeks.github.io/gridscore-next-training'>dedicated page<a/>.
pageAboutParagraphOne: GridScore is a field trial phenotyping app for trait data. It lets you keep track of what's happening in the field on a plot-level basis. This could be anything from plant emergence, flowering date, plant height, flower colour, etc.
pageAboutParagraphTwo: GridScore has been developed by Sebastian Raubach. Miriam Schreiber, Joanne Russel and Paul Shaw have been instrumental in testing GridScore. If you have any questions, suggestions or general feedback, please contact Sebastian.
pageAboutGridScoreFundersSubtitle: Organisations supporting GridScore - past and present
pageAboutGridScoreFundersText: We are very grateful for the funding GridScore has received over the years. Below is a list of our main funders who we have worked with closely during the development of GridScore.
pageAboutTranslationsText: GridScore has been translated into a number of languages thanks to our collaborators and the community. We would like thank everyone who has contributed to the translation of this software.
pageBrapiExportBrapiGermplasmIdText: {count}/{total} germplasm within this trial have a valid BrAPI database ID. Use the button below to run a query against the BrAPI server to check for matches.
pageBrapiExportBrapiTraitIdText: {count}/{total} traits within this trial have a valid BrAPI database ID. Use the button below to run a query against the BrAPI server to check for matches.
pageLoadExampleText: Select one of the example trials below to load it into GridScore. This will allow you to explore the functionalities of GridScore with a trial specifically designed to highlight certain features.
pageLoadExampleBarleyTrialDescription: A barley trial focusing on date-based traits. This is a good example of a simple setup.
pageLoadExampleTimelineDescription: An example of a trial containing traits that have been scored multiple times over a period of time.
pageLoadExampleMeasurementSetDescription: A trial highlighting the set measurement feature where 3 measurements are taken per plot and trait each time.
pageLoadExampleCowDescription: We don't just do plants, you can record data on basically anything, even cows!
pageLoadExampleTrainingDescription: A trial matching the GridScore Training material setup.
pageHomeWelcome: Welcome to GridScore - The open-source plant phenotyping app.
pageHomeInstructions: Start by setting up a new trial or by loading an exemplar dataset.
pageHomeCardSubtitleShareData: Import a trial that has been shared with you
pageHomeCardSubtitleLoadExample: Load one of the example datasets
pageHomeTextCitation:
Did you know we have a GridScore publication? Why not have a read and cite us if you find the software useful - give us a shout out too {'@'}HuttonICS or {'@'}GerminateHub/{'@'}GerminateHub or email us as we would love to hear about how you are using it. Feedback on how we can improve GridScore is always welcome!

GridScore: a tool for accurate, cross-platform phenotypic data collection and visualization

Raubach, S., Schreiber, M. & Shaw, P.D., BMC Bioinformatics 23, 214 (2022).
pageSettingsText: Use this page to tweak the global GridScore settings. These apply across all trials and are not shared with anyone when using the data synchronisation, because everyone has their own preferences.
pageSettingsCardGeneralSubtitle: These are settings affecting the overall interface and user experience.
pageSettingsCardDataCollectionSubtitle: Settings in this area relate to preferences while collecting data.
pageSettingsCardVisualSubtitle: This is where the visual representation within GridScore can be adjusted.
pageSettingsHomeWidgetOrderBannersDescri: The 'getting started' banners including setting up a new trial.
pageSettingsHomeWidgetOrderTrialsDescrip: The list of trials available locally on this device.
pageTrialEditTraitText: Here you can adjust the names, descriptions and groups of existing traits.
pageTrialTraitListText: Below is a list of the traits that have been defined and that will be used in the current trial.
pageTrialTraitListEmpty: No traits found. Use the form to add traits.
pageTrialSetupText: This is where you create a new trial. The sections below are used to provide general information about the trial, specify the layout including used germplasm, row and column count, and finally the traits you want to score need to be specified.
pageTrialLayoutDimensionsTextGrid: Use the input fields to specify the row and column count of your trial layout.
pageTrialLayoutDimensionsTextList: Use the input field to specify the item count of your trial layout.
pageTrialLayoutDimensionsFielDHubNotice: If you're importing a trial design from FielDHub, please make sure to select 'bottom to top' for the row order and 'left to right' for the column order.
pageTrialLayoutGermplasmText: Use the table below to enter the germplasm identifier and optional rep information for each plot. You can use the dropdown menu above the table to import data from other tools like FielDHub or Excel.
pageTrialLayoutCornersText: Optionally, specify the corner points of the trial layout. This information can be used both for data visualization purposes as well as an aid for navigation within the trial.
pageTrialLayoutMarkersText: Optionally, if you are using visual markers within the trial in the for of e.g. stakes, little flags or posts, you can specify their locations here. These will be shown on the main data input screen to help with navigation.
pageTrialSetupCardLayoutSubTitle: Define the layout of the trial including number of rows, columns, germplasm identifiers and reps as well as optional field corner points and visual markers.
pageTrialSetupCardTraitsSubTitle: Define the traits that will be scored in this trial along with their data types, recording sets and restrictions.
pageVisualizationMapText: This map shows any available field layout information as well as the locations where data has been collected.
pageVisualizationMapNoTraitData: No data for this trait found.
pageVisualizationStatisticsText: This page shows overview statistics for each trait. Numeric and date traits are visualized in a box plot while text and categorical traits are shown in bar charts.
pageVisualizationHeatmapText: This page visualizes data collected as part of this trial using heatmaps. Depending on the setup of your trial, you will see a field layout heatmap and a heatmap comparing different reps of the same germplasm.
pageVisualizationFieldHeatmapText: Please select a trait in the selection box below. The shown graph shows the field layout where each colored box represents a plot. The color of each plot is shown on a gradient scale. For numeric traits, this will represent the actual value, for time-based traits and text traits, this shows the scoring date as the number of days since the first scored plot. For categorical traits, the color represents the category value.
pageVisualizationGermplasmRepHeatmapText: Please select a trait in the selection box below. The heatmap below compares the values for the selected trait per germplasm across all reps. The color of each rep is shown on a gradient scale. For numeric traits, this will represent the actual value, for time-based traits and text traits, this shows the scoring date as the number of days since the first scored plot. For categorical traits, the color represents the category value.
pageVisualizationTimelineText: This page shows collected data in a temporal context. This can highlight temporal relations between traits as well as highlight interesting patterns within a trait.
pageVisualizationNoRepeatTraitsText: The following chart shows the percentage of scored plots over time. This highlights the development of plots as time goes on as well as the relationship between traits. The x-axis shows time, the y-axis shows the percentage of scored plots. Each trait is shown in their respective color.
pageVisualizationRepeatTraitsText: Below you can find a chart for each trait that has been scored over time showing the development of values in a temporal context. By default only the overall value range and average across all plots is shown for each time point, but by selecting a different option above the chart you can look at all plots or a selection of plots.
pageImportCameraText: Use your device's camera to scan the QR code. You may have to grant permission to use the camera and you may also have to switch cameras.
pageImportText: On this page you can import a trial that has been shared with you. Enter the trial share code below or use the QR code button next to the input to use your device's camera to scan a QR share code.
pageImportSelectAppVersion: Please select the version of GridScore you want to import the trial from.
pageImportTrialMatchInfo: The following match has been found for the share code you provided.
pageImportTrialMatchConfirm: Would you like to import this trial?
pageImportLegacyWarning: Before you import a trial from the legacy GridScore, make sure that any changes and new data has been synchronized from all devices. Once the trial has been imported into GridScore NEXT, changes and updates can only be made from GridScore NEXT and not the legacy version.
pageImportRemoteConfigText: You can synchonize data with a self-hosted GridScore NEXT server instance. Please provide the details of this instance below.
pageExportText: On this page you can export your trial in a variety of formats. Use the tabs to select the export format and then follow the instructions in the respective section to export your data.
pageExportTrialFormatTab: Here, data can be exported in flat text files. These files can be imported into tools like Excel, R or Python for further processing or analysis.
pageExportTrialFormatComment: The buttons below will export any trial or plot comments into a tab-delimited text file. If no trial or plot comments are available, the respective buttons will be disabled.
pageExportTrialFormatCommentTrialCardSub: Comments that have been added to the whole trial.
pageExportTrialFormatCommentTrialCount: No trial comment found.|One trial comment found.|{count} trial comments found.
pageExportTrialFormatCommentPlotCount: No plot comment found.|One plot comment found.|{count} plot comments found.
pageExportTrialFormatCommentPlotCardSubt: Comments that have been added to individual plots.
pageExportTrialFormatEvent: The buttons below will export any trial or plot events into a tab-delimited text file. If no trial or plot events are available, the respective buttons will be disabled.
pageExportTrialFormatEventTrialCardSubti: Events that have been added to the whole trial.
pageExportTrialFormatEventTrialCount: No trial event found.|One trial event found.|{count} trial events found.
pageExportTrialFormatTabWideDataCardSubt: Export the collected data into a tab-delimited text file which can be imported into other tools. The data will be in 'wide format', meaning germplasm is stored as rows, traits as columns and cells contain the trait measurements.
pageExportTrialFormatTabLongDataCardSubt: Export the collected data into a tab-delimited text file which can be imported into other tools. The data will be in 'long format', meaning the resulting file will contain a row for each individual measurement taken.
pageExportTrialFormatGerminate: If you are using Germinate and want to export your data in the Germinate Data Template Format then GridScore can do all the work for you. Simply click the button below to send your data to the GridScore server for processing. A download link will appear when the data is ready.
pageExportTrialFormatBrapi: Data can be exported directly to a BrAPI-compatible server assuming you have write permissions to the system. Use the button below to provide the BrAPI URL and authentication token and then select the program, trial and study to import data into. Please note that images, videos and comments cannot be exported to Germinate by using this mechanism.
pageExportTrialFormatBrapiGermplasmIdTex: {count}/{total} germplasm within this trial have a valid BrAPI database ID. Use the button below to run a query against the BrAPI server to check for matches.
pageExportTrialFormatBrapiTraitIdText: {count}/{total} traits within this trial have a valid BrAPI database ID. Use the button below to run a query against the BrAPI server to check for matches.
pageExportTrialFormatGerminateDataCardSu: Export the collected data straight into the Germinate Data Template for phenotypic trials data. This can then directly be uploaded to Germinate.
pageExportTrialFormatGerminateShapeCardS: Export the layout of this trial in form of a Shapefile. This can then directly be uploaded to Germinate.
pageExportTrialFormatLayout: Export the layout of this trial.
pageExportTrialFormatLayoutTrialCardSubt: Export the layout of this trial in tabular format.
pageExportTrialTraits: Export the traits used in this trial into specific formats.
pageExportTrialTraitsGerminateCardSubtit: Export the traits into the Germinate format used in the 'PHENOTYPES' tab of the Germinate data templates.
pageExportTrialTraitsGridScoreCardSubtit: Export the traits into the GridScore JSON format which can be used to re-import them at a later date.
pageArchiveSubtitle: An archived version of your trial has been found.
pageArchiveNoArchiveFound: No archive has been found for your trial. This either means that it has been a long, long time since you last used GridScore or that there has been an issue with backups. Please get in touch with the maintainers of GridScore.
pageGuidedWalkInvalidConfig: Invalid configuration for guided walk. Please try again.
pageGermplasmPerformanceText: This page shows the performance of the selected germplasm across its reps against the rest of the trial. For each numeric and date trait, you will find a scale that shows the whole range of values across that trait from minimum to maximum and the average value of the selected germplasm as a coloured vertical bar.
tabTextSettingsShareExport: The QR code below will let others load your settings and overwrite their own settings.
tabTextSettingsShareImport: Use your camera to scan another user's settings. These will overwrite your own settings.
toastTextBrapiTimeout: The request has timed out. Please try again later.
toastTextBrapiCallNotAvailable: The selected BrAPI server does not support the required API call.
toastDataInputRestrictedText: You have selected a plot outside of the marked columns/rows. To disable this restriction, please change the GridScore settings.
toastTextTrialShareCodeSameOrHigherPermi:
You already have this trial available on your device with the same or higher permission status.
Do you want to load your existing trial or import it as a new trial?
toastTextTrialShareCodeUpgrade: Are you sure you want to upgrade the permission status of your local trial?
toastTextTrialShareCodeAsNew: Are you sure you want to import this trial as a new, separate trial?
tooltipBrapiExportBrapiTraitRunSearch: Please run a lookup search before uploading your traits as new traits.
tooltipTraitTimeframeOutwithSuggest: This trait should not be scored outside of this time frame.
tooltipTraitTimeframeOutwithEnforce: This trait cannot be scored outside of this time frame.
tooltipTrialHasTransactions: This trial has local changes. Click to synchronize.
tooltipTrialHasRemoteUpdate: This trial has been updated by others. Click to load their changes.
tooltipViewTraitDataHistory: View recording history and make changes.
tooltipScanQRCodeAddGermplasm: Scan a QR-code/barcode to fill in the identifier
tooltipDataEntryCommentMicrophone: Use speech-to-text technology to convert your speech into text.
tooltipSetRecordingDate: Change the date for which the data will be recorded.
tooltipTrialSelectorTrialExpiryWarning: The expiry date of this trial on the GridScore server is {date} and it will subsequently no longer be available for synchronization. Please export it now or synchronize any outstanding changes to extend the storage period.
tooltipTraitImageUploadTrialNotShare: The trial needs to be shared before an image can be uploaded.
tourTextSetupStart: On this page, you can create a new trial. This tour will explain the individual areas of this page step by step.
tourTextSetupTrialName: The first thing that needs to be specified for a trial is its name.
tourTextSetupTrialDescription: Optionally, you can add a description to the trial as well. This can include any meta information you want to make available.
tourTextSetupTrialLayout: This section lets you define the trial layout including the dimensions, contained germplasm and geographic information.
tourTextSetupTrialTraits: This is where you define the traits that should be scored as part of this trial.
tourTextSetupTrialGroup: Group trials of the same project together for better organization.
tourTextDataEntryStart: This is the data input screen for the selected trial. It allows you to look at your field plan, search for entries and record data.
tourTextDataEntryCanvas: The table/grid below represents your field plan with rows and columns. Each cell represents a plot or pot. Select a plot to record data for it.
tourTextDataEntryTraits: This is a list of all traits to be scored in this trial. Select individual traits or use the buttons at the top to toggle their visibility.
tourTextDataEntryTrialInformation: This dropdown box contains information about the current trial. It is also where you can view and add trial comments.
tourTextDataEntryGermplasmSearch: Search for a plot/pot by using the germplasm identifier and (if available) rep number. You can also scan QR/barcodes to identify plots.
tourTextDataInputStart: This is the data input window for the selected plot. It's where you enter the data for the traits that have been defined for this trial.
tourTextDataInputTraitGroups: The traits are split into groups. Use these tabs to switch between groups.
tourTextDataInputTraits: The traits you see down here are the traits within the selected group.
tourTextDataInputTraitDetails: This section contains all the information and controls for the first trait in this group. We'll now go through them one by one.
tourTextDataInputTraitName: The name of the trait as well as its representative color are displayed here.
tourTextDataInputTraitDataType: This is the data type of this trait.
tourTextDataInputTraitAllowRepeats: This icon tells you whether or not the trait allows repeated data measurements over time. If it has a small x in the middle, then no repeated measurements are allowed.
tourTextDataInputTraitSetSize: The set size determines how many measurements for a plot are recorded at once. This usually represents how many individual plants per plot are scored at any point in time.
tourTextDataInputTraitHistory: You can look at previously recorded data by clicking on this button.
tourTextDataInputTraitCamera: Use this button to take photos for the current plot and tag them with the selected trait.
tourTextDataInputTraitDataInput: These input fields are used to enter the data for this trait and plot.
tourTextDataInputPickDate: If you want to retrospectively enter data for a specific recording date, use this calendar to select the date, then go on to record the data.
tourTextDataInputComments: Plot comments can be viewed and added here.
tourTextDataInputMarking: Individual plots can be marked or unmarked using this button.
tourTextDataInputCamera: Click here to take a photo of the overall plot.
tourTextDataInputGuidedWalk: You can start a guided walk from the selected plot by clicking here and selecting a guided walk order.
tourTextDataInputSave: Finally, when you have finished entering your data, click on the save button to persist your changes.
transactionTypePlotCommentAddedCount: Comments added to zero plots.|Comments added to one plot.|Comments added to {count} plots.
transactionTypePlotCommentDeletedCount: Comments deleted from zero plots.|Comments deleted from one plot.|Comments deleted from {count} plots.
transactionTypePlotMarkedChangedCount: Zero plots marked/unmarked.|One plot marked/unmarked.|{count} plots marked/unmarked.
transactionTypePlotGeographyChangedCount: Geography changed for zero plots.|Geography changed for one plot.|Geography changed for {count} plots.
transactionTypePlotDetailsChangedCount: Details changed for zero plots.|Details changed for one plot.|Details changed for {count} plots.
transactionTypePeopleAddedCount: No people added.|One person added.|{count} people added.
transactionTypeTrialCommentAddedCount: Zero trial comments added.|One trial comment added.|{count} trial comments added.
transactionTypeTrialCommentDeletedCount: Zero trial comments deleted.|One trial comment deleted.|{count} trial comments deleted.
transactionTypeTrialEventAddedCount: Zero trial events added.|One trial event added.|{count} trial events added.
transactionTypeTrialEventDeletedCount: Zero trial events deleted.|One trial event deleted.|{count} trial events deleted.
transactionTypeTrialModifiedText: A property of this trial like the name, description, visual markers or corner points has been modified.
transactionTypeTraitDataChangedCount: Trait data changed for zero plots.|Trait data changed for one plot.|Trait data changed for {count} plots.
transactionTypeTraitsModifiedCount: Details for zero traits changed.|Details for one trait changed.|Details for {count} traits changed.
transactionTypeBrapiIdsChangedGermplasmC: No germplasm ids updated.|One germplasm id updated.|{count} germplasm ids updated.
transactionTypeBrapiIdsChangedTraitCount: No trait ids updated.|One trait id updated.|{count} trait ids updated.
widgetTrialSelectorText: Below is a list of all trials available locally on this device. These are trials that you have created or that have been shared with you. Select a trial to see or visualize the contained data.
widgetTrialSelectorNoMatchFound: No matching trial found for your search query.
widgetGuideOrderUturnLeft: Make a U-turn to your left
widgetGuideOrderUturnRight: Make a U-turn to your right
widgetGuideOrderUpLeftBack: Up, back to start, step to left, up
widgetGuideOrderUpRightBack: Up, back to start, step to right, up
widgetGuideOrderDownLeftBack: Down, back to start, step to left, down
widgetGuideOrderDownRightBack: Down, back to start, step to right, down
widgetGuideOrderLeftUpBack: Left, back to start, step up, left
widgetGuideOrderLeftDownBack: Left, back to start, step down, left
widgetGuideOrderRightDownBack: Right, back to start, step down, right
widgetGuideOrderRightUpBack: Right, back to start, step up, right
widgetGuideOrderBackLeft: Go back to the start, then step left
widgetGuideOrderBackRight: Go back to the start, then step right
widgetGuideWidth: Score no plots at a time|Score 1 plot at a time|Score {count} plots at a time
widgetGuideWidthNeighborSelectorText: Select the neighbour of the currently selected plot to score at the same time.
widgetTrialSelectorWarningUpdates: No trial in this tab has pending remote updates. | One of the trials in this tab has pending remote updates. | {count} of the trials in this tab have pending remote updates.
widgetTrialSelectorWarningUpdatesLocal: No trial in this tab has pending local updates. | One of the trials in this tab has pending local updates. | {count} of the trials in this tab have pending local updates.
widgetTrialSelectorWarningExpiry: No trial in this tab is about to expire on the server. | One of the trials in this tab is about to expire on the server. | {count} of the trials in this tab are about to expire on the server.
widgetBrapiTrialImportErrorNoColumnInfor: No column index information for germplasm: {germplasm}
widgetBrapiTrialImportErrorNoRowInformat: No row index information for germplasm: {germplasm}
widgetBrapiTrialImportErrorNoGermplasmDb: No germplasm DB ID for unit: {germplasm}
widgetHelpToolbarInstallInstructions: To install GridScore on your device, please follow the link below for detailed instructions based on your device and operating system.
pageDataStatisticsText: This page gives you a statistical view onto the trials on your device. Select the trials to visualize below.
widgetDataPersonChartLineTitle: Data collected per person over time
widgetDataPersonChartBarTitle: Data collected per person per trait
pageSetupMediaFilenameUsedSubtitle: Bits of information encoded in the filename of images and videos.
pageSetupMediaFilenameUnusedSubtitle: Additional bits of information not encoded.
